Term.definition: A basic data type provided by a programming language, not an object.
Methods that belong to an object instance, not the class itself.
To create a specific instance of an object or array in memory using the 'new' keyword.
The entry point method in Java applications, defined as public static void main(String[] args).
A source code file written in the Java programming language, typically compiled to bytecode.
A program that translates source code into executable code or bytecode.
A single cycle or repetition of a loop's body in programming.
A statement that executes code only if a specified condition is true.
A method that belongs to an object instance, not to the class itself.
To assign an initial value to a variable when it is declared.
The set of rules that defines the structure of valid statements in a programming language.
A keyword that indicates a method or variable belongs to the class, not instances.
A method that returns the number of characters in a String.
The set of rules that defines how code must be written in a programming language.
Classes that encapsulate primitive data types as objects, like Integer for int in Java.
An output window where a program displays text or messages during execution.
Arrays with two dimensions, often used to represent grids or tables in Java.
A resizable array implementation in Java's Collections Framework, allowing dynamic storage and retrieval of objects.
A boolean variable indicating whether a customer has VIP status in the program.
A keyword in Java indicating a method or variable belongs to the class, not instances.
A symbol that performs an action on one or more values, such as +, -, *, or /.
A loop that never ends because its exit condition is never met.
Java Runtime Environment; provides libraries and resources to run Java applications.
A program that translates source code into executable code for the computer to run.
Rules that determine the order in which operators are evaluated in an expression.
Division operation where the result is an integer, discarding any fractional part.
A keyword in Java indicating a method does not return any value.
A class representing sheep objects, often used as an example in object-oriented programming.
Integrated Development Environment; software that provides tools for writing, testing, and debugging code.
The process of converting source code into machine code or bytecode for execution.
Java Virtual Machine; runs Java bytecode, enabling Java programs to be platform-independent.
A data type representing whole numbers, positive or negative, without decimals.
A statement used to exit a loop or switch statement immediately in Java.
Symbol (=) used to assign a value to a variable in Java.
The order in which operations are evaluated in an expression.
A special character (like \) used to represent characters not easily typed or visible.
A keyword that sets the visibility of a class member to other classes.
A resizable array implementation in Java, part of the java.util package.
A method that belongs to an object and operates on that object's data.
The act of calling or executing a method or function in code.
A resizable array implementation in Java, part of the java.util package.
A function defined inside a class in object-oriented programming, like Java.
A blueprint for creating objects, defining data and behavior in object-oriented programming.
Returns the index of a substring within a string, or -1 if not found.
An array structure with rows and columns, like a table or grid.
A function associated with an object or class in object-oriented programming.
A data type representing a sequence of characters in Java.
A control structure that repeats a block of code a specific number of times.
A numbering system using only two digits: 0 and 1, often representing true and false.
A statement formed by combining two or more expressions using logical operators.
A boolean variable indicating if the smart mode feature is enabled or disabled in the system.
A text-based interface for displaying output and receiving input from the user.
A movable indicator showing the current position for user input or output on the screen.
Variables that hold data specific to each object instance in a class.
A function defined inside a class, used to perform actions or return information.
An instance of a class containing data and methods defined by that class.
A sequence of characters, commonly used to represent text in Java.
The entry point of a Java application; where program execution begins.
A blueprint in Java for creating objects, defining attributes and methods.
A template or prototype that defines the structure and behavior of objects in a class.
A specific, individual object created from a class in Java.
The process of creating a new object from a class.
A special method used to initialize new objects of a class.
A program that translates source code into executable machine code.
A text-based interface for displaying output and accepting input from the user during program execution.
A possible path of execution in conditional statements, chosen based on evaluated conditions.
A data type representing true or false values, used for logical operations in Java.
The entry point of a Java application; where program execution begins.
Values passed into a method or constructor to customize its behavior.
Converting a variable from one data type to another, such as from int to double.
Exits the nearest enclosing loop immediately when executed.
Skips the current loop iteration and proceeds to the next iteration.
